feed.subtitle: Online Marketing Spezialist und Student an der Fachhochschule GraubÃ¼nden.

entry.title: Digital Marketing
entry.content:
My daily business

I have been working in marketing agencies for more than three years. At first, I was working as a desktop publisher, often doing creative work, such as layouting, designing and photography, until I started working increasingly in the digital field. At the moment I'm working part-time as an online marketing specialist besides studying for my bachelors degree, which I will finish next summer. I switched my job because the digital world was and still is exciting to me. I am very familiar with tools like Google Ads, Facebook Business and Ads Manager or Google Analytics and the Tag Manager - but still try to improve constantly. After all, there is something new to learn every day. In my daily business I work in the small agency "Stutz Kommunikation" where we assist SMEs to promote their businesses, guide them through the digital jungle and help them to win new customers.

entry.title: Photo- & Videography
entry.content:
back | next

Photography on the job â€¦

Photo- and videography: Topics that always interested me a lot. I learnt the basics of photography in my apprenticeship as print and media designer and used the knowledge later in my career. I had the chance of taking photos of clients and for the newspaper "Zofinger Tagblatt". My photos got printed and published several times. During my time at the digital agency #ztplus organising photo shoots was also part of my job. Besides taking photos behind the photo camera, I was regularly behind the video camera for live tv recordings in the studio of the local media outlet.

back | next

â€¦ and my personal projects

I always have my camera with me, especially when I travel. I love exploring cities with my camera and taking photos that have never been taken before or shared 100x on Instagram. My Fuji X100s from 2013 is still considered my best buy ever. The little cam has been everywhere with me: in Australia, New York, Paris and of course in the Swiss mountains. Can't wait to take it to Canada! There are missing a few pictures of it on my Instagram account. ðŸ˜ƒ

entry.title: Art & Design
entry.content:
back | next

Itâ€™s about testing

Pen and paper or even a brush have been used much less since I started working in marketing. However, the knowledge of design, composition or typography that I gained when I was a desktop publisher, often designing print and web projects, I can still use almost every day. Whether it is when creating mockups, in content creation or just in choosing a suitable font.

However, the knowledge of design, composition or typography that I gained when I was a desktop publisher, often designing print and web projects, I can still use almost every day. Whether it is when creating mockups, in content creation or just in choosing a suitable font.

entry.title: Data Science & Programming
entry.content:
back | next

Learn from data

At university, I was able to gain experience in the field of Data Science. For a Data Science project I had to use several Python libraries and frameworks such as Numpy, Seaborn, Pandas or Scrapy and save the collected data in a SQLite database before analyzing everything in Jupyter notebook with Pandas and Numpy. The realization: Data science is very similar to marketing. You learn from data and draw your conclusions and decisions from it.

Python and the web

Besides the data science projects, I used Python for other kinds of projects at university: small programs as well as larger ones. My favourite is still my Pyfeed project, in which Python is used on the web with the Flask framework.
entry.summary: back | next Learn from data At university, I was able to gain experience in the field of Data Science. For a Data Science project I had to use several Python libraries and frameworks such as Numpy, Seaborn, Pandas or Scrapy and save the collected data in a SQLite database before analyzing everything in Jupyter notebook with Pandas and Numpy. The realization: Data science is very similar to marketing. You learn from data and draw your conclusions and decisions from it. Python and the web Besides the data science projects, I used Python for other kinds of projects at university: small programs as well as larger ones. My favourite is still my Pyfeed project, in which Python is used on the web with the Flask framework.

entry.title: Web Development
entry.content:
back | next

My sandbox

In my job I had the opportunity to work with various content management systems such as Wordpress, Contao or Drupal as editor. However, in my spare time I am often trying new web frameworks and tools (such as GatsbyyJS, Wordpress or Jekyll) as a developer and designer for the sake of learning, and mostly because I enjoy coding. I also successfully completed the almost 30-hour long LinkedIn Learning Path "Junior Wordpress Developer", where I learned the basics of Wordpress as a developer. A particular interest of mine when developing is clean code and accessibility - a topic I already wrote a number of papers about at university.
